Package com.storytron.swat.util

This package contains various classes that are used by swat.

    DiskArray.ReadWriter<T>
    Interface for customizing the way reading and writing is done to the array.

    An auxiliary class for handling menus with many items.

    Implements a filter box that allows the user selecting options from a menu using the keyboard or the mouse.

    This class is a replacement for a FlowLayout inside a JScrollPane.

    Implements a wrapper for filtering elements in an Iterable object.
    LightweightPopup

    MaxLengthDocument

    Custom implementation for showing tooltips.

    PopupButton

    A dialog for showing a progress bar
    UndoableAction
    This class is for declaring undoable actions.
    UndoableSlider
    This is a class for undoing slider actions.

Package com.storytron.swat.util Description

This package contains various classes that are used by swat.

Undo support

Swat uses Swat.UndoManager a subclass of javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoManager to handle undo of operations. The class representing undoable edits is UndoableAction which subclasses AbstractUndoableEdit. UndoableAction is designed for being anonimously subclassed in the place in the code where the undoable action should be executed.

The special class com.storytron.swat.undo.UndoableSlider was implemented for undoing changes in JSliders. Sliders would register many little actions when dragging or using the keyboard to move the slider. This class get rid of the spurious actions registering only the last one.

Special GUI controls

Throughout the editors we are using the class com.storytron.swat.DropDown which allows reordering its elements by dragging them up and down in the popup list.

There two classes that we use to implement popups. We have our own lightweight popup LightweightPopup which can hold text editors. And we have ErrorPopup which behaves almost as a tooltip, and it is used to show errors when the input of the user is not valid.
